Protection.nameOfProject: Improving the lifes of vulnerable returnee- and host community households in Sinuni and Wana sub- districts through the provision of protection services and agricultural support (multi-cluster project)
Protection.objective: The overall objective of the protection component is to expand general protection services (including legal assistance/counselling, PSS & HLP) to underserved areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people living in Arab villages and Neighboring villages in Sinuni Sub district, Sinjar districts.

ProtectionHighlights.GeneralHighlights: IDP - CBP team continued distributing baby diapers to vulnerable individuals. These items were provided by UNHCR, this week 13 individuals received 25 packs of baby diapers (per PSN) in Duhok and Zakho.

SGBVActivities.activity: Non- structured psycho-social support (PSS) activities for children and adolescents
protection needs identified and referred to specialized services
PSS sessions for children to cope their stress and fears during COVID-19
Service providers  trained on GBV prevention and referral
POCs trained on GBV prevention and referral

SGBVHighlights.GeneralHighlights: SGBV unit conducted Domestic Violence campaign for Syrian and Non-Syrian refugees in camps and non- camps in During Sep 2020. The purpose behind it; to reduce this kind of violence and explain the way of referral and reporting for PoCs.
SGBV unit conduct safety audit assessmnet in refugee's camps (Domiz1, Akre and Bardarash) to be aware of the refugee's main concerns and difficulities of accessing the resources and find solutions.
CLC- Domiz Manager has attended monthly CCM meeting that was online, during the meeting update and more plans for the camp have been discussed for September 2020.
CLC- Domiz Manager and APM for GBV have attended GBVIMS meeting via Skype.
APM for GBV has attended Duhok PSEA task force meetinf via Skype.

CLC-Gawilan manager has attended Gawilan monthly protection meeting which was conducted by camp management in registration office during the meeting all updates from other agencies shared with activities, plans for September and challenges inside the camp
CLC/Bardarash center manager has attended UNHCR online Bardarash protection meeting.
CLC/ Bardarash center manager has attended camp coordination meeting with camp management.

CAC staff have attended in different child protection trainings such as ( Communication with Children and their Families and Case Management SOP & Principles and CPIMS+ forms Training ) which is given by Triangle NGO through online platform.
CAC staff have paricipated in structured PSS training which is given by WCUK for one week.
CPO has attended MRM training for two days.

WASHActivities.activity: Provision of water through boreholes operations in Chamishku camp
Provision of water through boreholes operations in Essian camp
Care and Maintenance of water network in Chamishku camp
care and Maintenance of water network in Essian camp
Care and Maintenance of sanitation facilities in Chamishku camp
Care and Maintenance of sanitation facilities in Essian camp

WASHHighlights.GeneralHighlights: Construction of 2km of open channels in Chamishku camp has started.
3 garbage collection trucks in Sinjar-Sinone were repaired.
BoQ of seperation of latrines and showers in Essian camp is finalized and the tendering process started.
17 community volunteers in Sinjar were recruited.
25 personnel (12 male & 13 female) were trained on PHAST approach for 5 days in Chamishku camp, Essian camp, and Sinjar.
